DialogueTree.DisplayName: Captain's Request

Node.Text: *The captain looks at you expectantly*
Traveler! You look capable. We desperately need help.
Bandits have been terrorizing our roads. Trade has all but stopped.
Any progress against the bandits? The people are growing desperate.

Choice.Text: I've been dealing with their scouts.

Node.Text: You've done it! The roads are safe again. You have our eternal gratitude.
Their leader calls themselves the Chief. They've organized the rabble into a real threat.
They ambush caravans, kidnap merchants for ransom, and threaten our village.
There's an official bounty on the Chief's head - 200 credits.
Plus, keep whatever you recover from their hideout. Gods know they've stolen enough.

Choice.Text: Tell me more about them first.

Node.Text: Their hideout is somewhere in the hills, but we don't know exactly where.
If you deal with their scouts on the roads, one of them might have a map.
We estimate a dozen at least, maybe more. Their scouts patrol the roads.
The Chief has a few enforcers - brutal fighters who do the dirty work.
Thank the gods. Be careful out there - they're more organized than common thugs.
I understand. If you change your mind, please return. People are suffering.
Good! Every bandit you defeat weakens their organization.
Keep at it - once you find their hideout, strike fast.
Please hurry. Another caravan was attacked just yesterday.

DialogueTree.DisplayName: Bandit Scout

Node.Text: Hold it right there! Empty your pockets and you might live.

Choice.Text: [Intimidate] I'm hunting your Chief. Run while you can.

Node.Text: *The scout's eyes widen with fear...*
Wait! Don't hurt me! Here, take this map - it shows where the hideout is!
Just let me go, please!
Ha! Big words from a dead person. Get them!
You're going to regret this!

DialogueTree.DisplayName: Boss Battle

Node.Text: So, you're the one who's been causing trouble for my people.
I've killed a dozen like you. You'll be just another notch on my blade.
Hmm. You've got some skill. More than those fools in the village, at least.
But skill alone won't save you!
ENOUGH! I didn't claw my way to power to be beaten by some wanderer!
This... this can't be happening. I am the CHIEF!
Surrender? ME?
...Perhaps I was wrong about you. You have strength AND honor.
Very well. I yield. Take what you will - just spare my life.
Then I'll take you with me!

DialogueTree.DisplayName: Prisoner Rescue

Node.Text: *You approach the captive*
Oh thank the gods! I thought I was done for!
Those monsters were going to ransom me - or worse.

Choice.Text: You're safe now. Get out of here.

Node.Text: Thank you again for saving me! I won't forget this kindness.
Thank you, thank you! Here, take this - it's all I have left, but you've earned it.
The Chief keeps the best loot in a chest in the back. Combination is 4-7-2.
Please, get me out of here!

DialogueTree.DisplayName: Victory Report

Node.Text: Is that... the Chief's badge? You actually did it!
This calls for celebration! The roads are safe again!
Of course, of course! You've more than earned it.
The bounty is paid. You have the gratitude of our entire community.

DialogueTree.DisplayName: A Concerned Plea

Node.Text: *A worried elder approaches you*
Please, stranger... I don't know who else to turn to.
There's a prophet who has come to our community. Many believe they're divine.
Have you learned anything? More people join the prophet every day.
People are giving away everything they own. Families are being torn apart.
And anyone who questions... they disappear. Or change. Become blank-eyed followers.
I want to believe. But I've seen things. Tricks that could be explained.
And my niece... she joined them. Now she won't speak to me.
No! You don't understand. She was full of life. Now she's... empty.
Please. Something is wrong here.
Will you look into this? Find the truth?
There's a scholar in town who shares my doubts. They might help.

Choice.Text: I'll find out what's really happening.

Node.Text: Thank you. Be careful - the prophet has many devoted followers.
Please don't wait too long. Every day, more fall under their spell.

DialogueTree.DisplayName: The Skeptic's Research

Node.Text: Ah, another skeptic? Good. I was beginning to feel like the only sane person left.
I've been documenting the prophet's so-called miracles. None hold up to scrutiny.
The 'healing waters' are laced with stimulants. The 'visions' coincide with herbal smoke.
And the prophet's inner circle? They all grew wealthy right before joining.

Choice.Text: Where can I find more proof?

Node.Text: Some. The devoted ones are... unsettling. They repeat the same phrases.
But I've found a former follower willing to talk. In secret.
The prophet's private quarters. They claim to own nothing, but I've heard rumors of hidden wealth.
Also, speak to the former follower I mentioned. They know things.
Once. They smiled and welcomed my 'curiosity.' Then their guards followed me home.
Be careful. They don't tolerate threats to their operation.
The old mill outside town. They're hiding there, afraid to show their face.
They'll only speak to someone they trust. Tell them I sent you.

DialogueTree.DisplayName: The Former Believer

Node.Text: *startles* Who- oh. The scholar sent you?
*looks around nervously* I shouldn't be talking about this.

Choice.Text: I'm trying to help people. Please.

Node.Text: *sighs* I know. I was once where they are now. Blind. Devoted.
The prophet... they have a gift. A real one. Charisma. Presence. It's intoxicating.
Those who leave... they have accidents. Get sick. Their families suffer.
The prophet claims ignorance, but we all know.
I saw behind the curtain. Literally. The 'miracles' are staged. Props, timing, drugs in the food.
I stole this before I fled. *holds up a fake glowing stone*
This is what makes the 'divine light' appear. Chemicals.

Choice.Text: Is the prophet aware it's all fake?

Node.Text: That's the strange part. I think... I think they believe it themselves now.
They started as a fraud, but somewhere along the way, they convinced themselves.
The prophet's quarters have ledgers. Proof of where all the 'donations' really go.
But be careful. The temple guardians are devoted. They'll fight for their prophet.

DialogueTree.DisplayName: Meeting the Prophet

Node.Text: *the prophet regards you with piercing eyes*
A seeker. I sense... doubt in you. But also potential.

Choice.Text: I have questions about your teachings.

Node.Text: And I have heard of you, traveler. Your reputation precedes you.
Perhaps you're meant to join us. The divine works in mysterious ways.
Questions are welcome. Truth fears no inquiry.
What troubles your spirit?

Choice.Text: How do you perform your miracles?

Node.Text: *the prophet's smile doesn't waver*
Many have thought so. They usually change their minds... one way or another.
Different? They have found peace. Purpose. Is that so strange?
In a world of chaos, unity is a gift.
The divine flows through me. I am merely a vessel.
Those who believe... can also become vessels.
*the prophet's hands begin to glow*
See? The light of truth illuminates all.

Choice.Text: I know how that trick works.

Node.Text: We teach that the world is broken. Only through unity can it be healed.
Individual desires create conflict. We transcend such things.
Then why are you here? *eyes narrow slightly*
I threaten no one. But the faithful... they protect what they love.
I would hate for anything unfortunate to happen to you.
*you hold up the fake relic*
*the prophet's face flickers - surprise, then calculation*
Where did you... no matter. You have proof of nothing.
The faithful will never believe you over me. GUARDS!
Many are. Perhaps you will join us in time.
Then satisfy your curiosity and go. We have work to do.

DialogueTree.DisplayName: Searching for Truth

Node.Text: *You slip into the prophet's private quarters*
*The room is lavishly decorated - hardly the 'simple life' they preach*
*Hidden behind a false wall panel, you find stacks of financial records*
*Donations, bribes, property purchases... the prophet is wealthy beyond measure*
*In a locked chest, you find correspondence. Dark correspondence.*
*The prophet has been consorting with... something. Promising souls in exchange for power.*
*You hear footsteps approaching*
*A guard passes by without noticing you*
*You slip away with your evidence*
*A temple guardian blocks your exit*
Intruder! You dare defile the prophet's sanctuary!

DialogueTree.DisplayName: The Final Revelation

Node.Text: *You gather the followers and the prophet for the final reckoning*
*The crowd watches expectantly. What evidence will you present?*
*Murmurs spread through the crowd as they see the ledgers*
*The prophet steps forward*
Yes... yes, I took your money. But I gave you something more valuable - purpose!

Choice.Text: Let them decide what to do with you.

Node.Text: *Gasps of horror as you read the correspondence aloud*
*The prophet's composure finally breaks*
You fool! You don't understand what I was protecting you from!

Choice.Text: You sold their souls for power.

Node.Text: The entity... it was coming regardless. I bargained for time!
My 'fraud' was a shield! Without me, it would have consumed this whole village!

Choice.Text: Then help us stop it properly.

Node.Text: *The prophet hesitates* You would... trust me? After everything?
*slowly* There is a ritual. To sever the connection. But it requires my death.

Choice.Text: There has to be another way.

Node.Text: The scholar... they might know ancient rites. Together, perhaps...
*the prophet kneels* I will submit to judgment after. If I survive.
Then I will make amends. Tell them... tell them I was a fool who tried to do good.
*The prophet begins a ritual, light consuming them*
*The crowd surges forward angrily*
*The prophet backs away, genuine fear in their eyes*

Choice.Text: Let the people have their justice.
[Protect] Everyone stop! This isn't the way.

Node.Text: *The prophet sighs* Very well. The ill-gotten wealth will be returned to the people.
*The crowd's mood is dark but uncertain*
*An elder speaks* They should stand trial. Proper justice.
*The crowd advances*
*The prophet doesn't resist*
*You stand between the prophet and the crowd*
*Slowly, the anger fades to shame*
*An elder nods* You're right. We're better than this.

DialogueTree.DisplayName: Prophet Combat

Node.Text: You would raise a weapon against the divine? Blasphemy!
The faithful will avenge me!
No... no, this isn't possible. I am chosen!
Please... I'll give you anything. Power, wealth, knowledge!

Choice.Text: There's only one thing I want.

Node.Text: *The prophet drops their weapon*
Then I yield. Do what you must.
Then we finish this!

DialogueTree.DisplayName: The Eccentric's Offer

Node.Text: *The eccentric collector notices you*
Ah, a customer! Looking for something special? I have curiosities from all over.
Wait... you have that look. The look of an adventurer.
Any luck with that map? I'm curious what it leads to...
So? What did you find? Don't leave me in suspense!
I acquired something... unusual. A map. Very old.
It's marked with symbols I can't read. But the location... it's nearby.
*unrolls a faded, ancient map*
See these markings? I believe they lead to something hidden. Something valuable.
Scam? I'm insulted! This is a genuine artifact!
Fine, if you're not interested, someone else will be.
An estate sale. The previous owner was a scholar of ancient sites.
He spent years searching for... something. Never found it, poor soul.
*The collector sizes you up*
For someone who knows the value of a good treasure? 50 credits.

Choice.Text: 30 credits, take it or leave it.

Node.Text: 75 credits. It could lead to fortune!
40. That's my final offer, and I'm being generous.
Excellent! May fortune smile upon your search.
A word of advice - the local historian knows the old symbols. Might be worth a visit.
You drive a hard bargain! Here you go.
The historian in town might help decipher those markings.
As you wish. Come back if you change your mind.

DialogueTree.DisplayName: Scholar's Knowledge

Node.Text: May I help you with something?
*studies the map intently* Fascinating! These are ancient protective glyphs.
This isn't just a map - it's a puzzle. Each location reveals a clue to the next.
There are legends of hidden caches throughout the land. Treasures hidden during times of war.
This could be one of them. Or it could be a tomb. Either way, be careful.
This first symbol... it represents the 'stone that weeps'. Old texts mention a rock formation.
There's a waterfall in the eastern hills. Look for a cleft in the rock behind it.
Safe travels, friend.

DialogueTree.DisplayName: The Hermit's Warning

Node.Text: *A weathered figure blocks your path*
Outsider. You seek the old places. I've watched others try.

Choice.Text: Do you know where I'm going?

Node.Text: The weeping stone, then the twin peaks, then the hollow oak. Three trials before the door.
But the guardians still walk. They do not sleep.
Machines of the old ones. They feel no pain, no mercy. Built to protect forever.
The key disables them. Without it, they will destroy you.
Here. The way is marked by signs only the patient can see.
*hands you a crude drawing*
Hmph. Pride goeth before destruction. Find your own way, then.

DialogueTree.DisplayName: Rival Encounter

Node.Text: Well, well. Looks like I'm not the only one following that map's trail.
I've been tracking this cache for months. You're not taking it from me.

Choice.Text: There's enough for both of us.

Node.Text: Share? Hmm. You seem capable enough...
Fine. We work together, split the haul. But I keep any artifacts.

Choice.Text: The artifacts are the whole point.

Node.Text: Alright, partner. I've found the third marker - it's near the old oak grove.
But there's something guarding the approach. We'll need to work together.
A race then! May the best treasure hunter win.
But don't come crying when I beat you to it.
*In their haste, they drop a worn note showing the final location*
So that's how it is? Fine - I didn't want to share anyway!

DialogueTree.DisplayName: Guardian Awakens

Node.Text: *ANCIENT MECHANISM ACTIVATES*
*INTRUDER DETECTED. INITIATING DEFENSE PROTOCOL.*
*CRITICAL DAMAGE SUSTAINED. INCREASING COMBAT INTENSITY.*

DialogueTree.DisplayName: The Hidden Cache

Node.Text: *The ancient door responds to the key, grinding open for the first time in centuries*
*Inside, you see the glint of gold and the shapes of ancient objects*

Choice.Text: Grab what you can and leave.

Node.Text: *Among the treasure, you find ancient writings...*
*They speak of a great war and those who hid these treasures to preserve them*

Choice.Text: Take the treasure and the knowledge.

Node.Text: *You grab handfuls of coins and several valuable-looking items*
*You emerge with treasure and knowledge of a forgotten age*
*You emerge richer, if not wiser*

DialogueTree.DisplayName: The Trap Room

Node.Text: *Click* The floor shifts beneath your feet. Ancient mechanisms whir to life.

Choice.Text: [Careful] Look for a way to disable it.

Node.Text: *You react instinctively...*
*You roll aside as darts whistle past where you were standing*
That was close. The mechanism seems spent now.
*You're not quite fast enough - a dart grazes your arm*
Painful, but not lethal. The trap is exhausted now.
*You spot the mechanism's core - a series of counterweights*
*Carefully, you jam a stone into the gears*

DialogueTree.DisplayName: The Legend

Node.Text: *the bard strums their instrument* You look like someone seeking more than coin.
Shall I tell you of the Lost Technique? A skill so powerful, empires once warred over it?
Long ago, there was a master who could defeat a hundred foes with a single movement.
The technique was called the Singular Path. It combined body, mind, and spirit into one perfect action.
*leans in* They say the last master still lives. High in the mountains, far from the world.
Many have sought them. Few have returned. None have learned the technique.
Perhaps. Perhaps not. But I've met one who trained under the master - briefly.
They were... changed. Even their failure left them formidable.

Choice.Text: Where can I find this master?

Node.Text: The mountains beyond the great valley. There's a village at the base.
The elders there know the old paths. But be warned - the journey is a trial itself.
As you wish. But some stories seek those who need to hear them.

DialogueTree.DisplayName: The Bitter One

Node.Text: *a scarred figure blocks your path*
You're going to the mountain. I can see it in your eyes. Don't.
Trained there. For three years. Came so close to mastering it.
Then the master said I lacked... something. Sent me away.

Choice.Text: Maybe you just weren't good enough.

Node.Text: *bitter laugh* 'Harmony,' they said. 'You fight against yourself, not with yourself.'
Riddles. It's all riddles with them. The technique is real though. Devastatingly real.

Choice.Text: What can you tell me about the trials?

Node.Text: Three trials. Body, mind, spirit. The first is combat. The second is patience.
The third... I never learned. Failed before I got there.
*sighs* Maybe you'll do better.
*eyes flash with anger* Careful. I may have failed, but I learned enough to crush most warriors.
Pride. That'll be your downfall too.
*steps aside* Go on then. Die on that mountain for all I care.
*calms down* Just... be careful. The master sees everything. Every flaw. Every weakness.
Your funeral.
Good luck. You'll need it.

DialogueTree.DisplayName: The Elder's Guidance

Node.Text: You seek the master on the mountain. *nods slowly* We see your kind, from time to time.

Choice.Text: Can you show me the path?
What can you tell me about the master?

Node.Text: The path is marked by white stones. Follow them to the summit.
But the mountain tests those who climb. A guardian waits at the halfway point.

Choice.Text: How do I defeat the guardian?

Node.Text: They came here decades ago. Already old then. Now? Who knows.
They asked only for solitude. We provide supplies; they leave us in peace.
The guardian doesn't fight to kill. They fight to test your resolve.
Show courage, and they will let you pass. Show fear or cruelty... they will not.
May the mountain judge you worthy.

DialogueTree.DisplayName: The Rival Seeker

Node.Text: *another traveler approaches from the opposite direction*
You're going to the master too? Ha! Then we're rivals.

Choice.Text: There's room for both of us to learn.
Turn back. I was here first.

Node.Text: *considers* Perhaps. The master might take multiple students. Or perhaps not.
Let's travel together for now. The mountain is dangerous.
*grins* I like you. Fair competition then. First to reach the top wins.
No sabotage, no tricks. Just speed and skill.
*hand moves to weapon* That's not how this works. The mountain is open to all seekers.
Back down, or we settle this now.
Good. Two is better than one against the guardian. I've heard stories.
Let's go. Time is wasting.
Your choice. See you at the top - if you make it.
Then let's move! The mountain awaits!
*relaxes* Wise choice. I don't want to fight anyway. Not before the real challenge.
Your arrogance will be your downfall!

DialogueTree.DisplayName: The Master's Test

Node.Text: *an elderly figure sits in meditation, seemingly unaware of your approach*
*without looking up* You have come far. But distance traveled means nothing.

Choice.Text: I seek to learn the Lost Technique.

Node.Text: *finally looks at you* Many seek. Few are worthy. Why should I teach you?

Choice.Text: I am dedicated to mastering this art.
To protect those I care about.

Node.Text: *a long moment passes*
*the master opens their eyes* Patience. The first lesson, and you already understand.
Tell me - why do you seek this path?
Dedication is necessary. But it is not enough. The river is dedicated to the sea, yet it still drowns.

Choice.Text: Then test me. Let me prove myself.

Node.Text: *nods slowly* A worthy goal. But can you protect without becoming what you fight?
The technique gives great power. Power corrupts even the righteous.
*eyes narrow* Power for its own sake? Then you have already failed.
Leave this mountain. You are not welcome here.

Choice.Text: Then I'll take the technique by force.

Node.Text: *smiles slightly* The deepest answer, and the hardest path.
Very well. I will test you. Three trials - body, mind, and spirit.
Speak to me again when you are ready for the first trial.
Words are wind. Actions speak truth. You will face three trials.
Pass them, and I will teach you. Fail, and you leave - forever.
Speak to me again when you are ready for the first trial.
*studies you carefully* Honesty in admitting error. That is something.
I will give you one chance. Three trials. Do not disappoint me again.
Speak to me again when you are ready for the first trial.
*sighs* How predictable.

DialogueTree.DisplayName: Trial of the Body

Node.Text: The first trial tests your body. You will spar with me.
This is not about winning. It is about showing what you are capable of.
I will match your intensity. Push yourself, and I will push back.
Show me your limits. Then we can discuss breaking them.
*rises smoothly* Show me what you've learned.

DialogueTree.DisplayName: Training Spar

Node.Text: Good stance. But stance is just the beginning.
You're wounded. Do you yield, or do you continue?
Courage. Good. But know when perseverance becomes stubbornness.
Enough. You have passed the first trial.
Wisdom to know your limits. That is also strength.
*slight nod* Better than most. You have trained well.
Enough. You have passed the first trial.

DialogueTree.DisplayName: Trial of the Mind

Node.Text: The second trial tests your mind. You will sit in meditation until I release you.
You may face visions. Temptations. Doubts. Do not move. Do not speak.
As long as it needs to. Hours. Days. The mind must learn stillness.
*gestures to a spot on the ground* Begin.
*Hours pass. Your body screams for movement. Your mind races.*
*A vision appears - everything you desire, within reach. Just stand up and take it.*
*A voice whispers* You're wasting time. You could be training, fighting, DOING something.
*The master's voice breaks through* You may open your eyes.
*A full day has passed* You have passed the second trial. Your mind is disciplined.
*The master sighs* You have failed. Your mind controls you, not the other way around.
*pauses* However, I see genuine effort. Rest tonight, and try again tomorrow.
*The next day arrives. You take your position once more.*

DialogueTree.DisplayName: Trial of the Spirit

Node.Text: The final trial tests your spirit. This is the hardest trial of all.
I will ask you a question. There is no right answer - only YOUR answer.
You have mastered the technique. Before you stands a villain - one who has hurt many.
Using the technique, you could destroy them utterly. Or spare them.
Which do you choose?

Choice.Text: I would destroy them. Some evil must be ended.
I would spare them. Death is too easy.
I would give them a choice.

Node.Text: *nods* Decisive. Perhaps too quick to judge - but there is clarity in your resolve.
You know yourself. That is what this trial measures.
You have passed the final trial. You are ready to learn.
*considers* Compassion can be weakness - or the greatest strength.
You have chosen a harder path. But you have chosen with conviction.
You have passed the final trial. You are ready to learn.
*eyes widen slightly* Unexpected. You would burden them with choice, as I burden you.
That is wisdom beyond your years. You understand that the technique is just a tool.
You have passed the final trial. You are ready to learn.

DialogueTree.DisplayName: The Teaching

Node.Text: You have passed all three trials. You are worthy.
The technique cannot be taught with words. It must be felt.
*The master moves - a single motion, impossibly fast and impossibly smooth*
*Every movement in their life has led to this. Every breath, every thought, unified.*
*You try. You fail. But in failing, you understand something.*
*Days of practice follow. Slowly, the pieces come together.*
*Finally, it happens. Body, mind, and spirit align. For one perfect moment, you ARE the technique.*
*The master watches, a rare smile on their face*
You have learned. Now, you must master. That will take a lifetime.
Thank me by living well. By using what you've learned with wisdom.
*hands you a small token* Take this. You are now part of the lineage.
When I am gone, you will be the last. Perhaps one day, you will teach another.

DialogueTree.DisplayName: The Victim's Plea

Node.Text: *The elder looks at you expectantly*
Please, you must help me! My family's most precious treasure has been stolen!
It has been in our family for generations. Without it, we are dishonored.

Choice.Text: I'll help you find it. What happened?
I'm sorry, I can't help right now.

Node.Text: Have you found anything? Please, any news?

Choice.Text: [Has thief identified] I found some evidence.

Node.Text: Thank you again for returning our treasure. You will always be welcome here.
It happened last night. I heard nothing, but when I woke, it was gone.
The lock wasn't broken - whoever did this knew what they were doing.
It is an ancient heirloom, passed down through countless generations.
Its value is beyond mere currency - it represents our family's honor and legacy.

Choice.Text: I need to think about this.

Node.Text: The neighbor mentioned seeing someone unfamiliar lurking around yesterday.
Perhaps they can tell you more?
Yes, please. Look around carefully - perhaps you'll find something I missed.

Choice.Text: I found muddy footprints and torn cloth. This gives me a lead.

Node.Text: Thank you! I will reward you well if you can recover our treasure.
I understand. If you change your mind, please return. Time is of the essence.
Please hurry. Every moment that passes, the thief could sell it to someone else.
You know who took it? That's wonderful news! Please, recover it if you can.
Any evidence is helpful. Keep looking - you're on the right track.

DialogueTree.DisplayName: Witness Testimony

Node.Text: *The neighbor notices you*
You're investigating the theft? Good. That poor family deserves justice.
Hello there. Can I help you with something?
I saw someone I didn't recognize, moving furtively near their home.
They wore dark clothing and seemed nervous. When they noticed me watching, they fled.
It was late - past midnight. I couldn't sleep, which is why I was looking outside.
They ran toward the outskirts. There's an abandoned building out there...
I've heard rumors that unsavory types use it as a hideout.
They were of medium build, moved quickly. The cloth of their sleeve was torn.
I remember thinking it looked freshly ripped.

Choice.Text: The torn cloth matches evidence from the scene!

Node.Text: Good luck. I hope you catch whoever did this.

DialogueTree.DisplayName: Confronting the Thief

Node.Text: *You approach the thief*
Wait! Don't come any closer! How did you find me?

Choice.Text: Give back what you stole. Now.

Node.Text: Who are you? What do you want?

Choice.Text: I'm looking for a stolen heirloom.

Node.Text: I don't know what you're talking about. Get lost.

Choice.Text: I have evidence that says otherwise.

Node.Text: Look, I... I didn't want to do it. I had no choice!
My family is starving. The crops failed and the landlord demands rent we can't pay.
I thought... I thought if I sold it, we could survive the winter.

Choice.Text: There had to be another way.
I understand, but you must return it.

Node.Text: I know. I've been sick with guilt ever since. But what choice did I have?
Watch my children starve?

Choice.Text: Return the heirloom and I'll speak to the victim on your behalf.
That's not my problem. Give it back.

Node.Text: You... you would do that? After what I've done?
Here. Take it. I'm sorry. I'm so sorry.
Fine. But I already sold it to a dealer. I can tell you where, for a price.

Choice.Text: [Attack] I'll beat it out of you.

Node.Text: 50 credits. That's what I need to feed my family.
The dealer works out of the market district. Look for the shady stall near the back.
Be careful - they don't take kindly to accusations.
Then we have nothing more to discuss.
I won't go down without a fight!

DialogueTree.DisplayName: Thief Battle

Node.Text: You'll regret this!
Stop! Please! I yield!
I'll tell you everything. Just spare me.

Choice.Text: Tell me where the heirloom is.
You should have thought of that before.

Node.Text: I sold it to a dealer in the market. The shady one near the back.
Please, let me go. I have a family.
No... no!

DialogueTree.DisplayName: Dealing with the Fence

Node.Text: *The dealer looks you over*
What do you want? I run a legitimate business here.

Choice.Text: You bought stolen goods. I want them back.
I'm looking for a particular item.

Node.Text: Looking for something special? I have... unique merchandise.

Choice.Text: I'm looking for a specific heirloom.

Node.Text: Stolen? I had no idea. Everything here was purchased fairly.
But if you want it back... well, I have expenses to cover.
Ah yes, I may have acquired something matching that description recently.
A fine piece. Very valuable.
*The dealer assesses your bargaining skills*
For someone of your... negotiating prowess... 100 credits.
200 credits. Firm price. Take it or leave it.
80 credits. That's my final offer. I'm already losing money here.
Pleasure doing business. And remember - you never saw me.
You'll regret that decision!

DialogueTree.DisplayName: Returning the Heirloom

Node.Text: Is that... could it be? You found it!

Choice.Text: Here. Your family's treasure is safe.

Node.Text: *The elder examines the heirloom*
Words cannot express my gratitude. You've restored our family's honor.
And you showed mercy to the thief? You are truly noble.
Please accept this additional reward for your compassion.
Thank you! Thank you! Our family is whole again.
Please, accept this reward for your service.

DialogueTree.DisplayName: Refugees' Plea

Node.Text: Please, stranger... we need help. We're fleeing for our lives.
We have children, elderly... we cannot defend ourselves.

Choice.Text: Where are you trying to go?

Node.Text: We're ready to move when you give the word. The longer we wait, the closer they get.
We have found peace here, thanks to you. You saved us all.
Our village was attacked. They said we were harboring enemies, but we're just farmers.
We fled with nothing. Now they hunt us like animals.
There's a safe territory beyond the mountains. If we can cross the border, we'll be safe.
But the journey is dangerous, and we're being pursued.

Choice.Text: Tell me more about the danger.

Node.Text: A day, maybe less. Their scouts are skilled trackers.
Please... our children are terrified. Will you help us?

Choice.Text: This is too dangerous for me.

Node.Text: Thank the gods! You have a kind heart. We won't forget this.
Thank you, thank you! I'll gather everyone immediately.
The young ones will help carry supplies. Our healer can tend any wounds.
I... I understand. May the gods watch over you, then.
May fortune guide our steps. Stay close, everyone!
*The group sets off. After hours of travel, you reach the first waypoint.*
You're right. I'll have our healer gather what medicine we have left.

DialogueTree.DisplayName: Volunteer Fighter

Node.Text: I want to fight alongside you. I'm tired of feeling helpless.
My family... they didn't make it. Let me protect the others.

Choice.Text: Stay with the group. They need you there.
Alright. Stay close and follow my lead.

Node.Text: I worked the forge before... before everything. I'm strong. Quick to learn.
Give me a chance. I won't let you down.
I won't disappoint you. For my family - and for everyone here.
I understand. I'll protect them from within the group, then.

DialogueTree.DisplayName: Lost Child

Node.Text: The child! Where is the child?! They were right here!
Oh gods, they must have wandered off when we stopped to rest.

Choice.Text: I'll find them. Keep the group together.
We can't stop. They'll catch up.

Node.Text: Please hurry! They're just a child... they'll be so frightened.
No! We can't leave them! Please, I'm begging you!

Choice.Text: We have no choice. We move now.

Node.Text: How could you... monsters. You're just as bad as them.

DialogueTree.DisplayName: Finding the Child

Node.Text: *The child is huddled behind a rock, crying softly*

Choice.Text: It's okay. I'm here to take you back to the others.
Come on, quickly. We need to go.

Node.Text: *sniff* I was so scared... I thought the bad people got me...
Thank you for coming. I'll stay close, I promise.
*The child nods, terrified, and follows you silently*

DialogueTree.DisplayName: The Stranger's Truth

Node.Text: *You notice the stranger slipping away from the group at night*

Choice.Text: [Confront] Where do you think you're going?

Node.Text: *The stranger meets with a pursuer scout and exchanges words*
They're pointing back toward the refugee camp...

Choice.Text: [Wait] Let them finish, then deal with this.

Node.Text: I... I needed air. The stress of travel...
*The scout leaves. The stranger returns, unaware they were seen*
*In the morning light, you reveal what you witnessed*
The refugees gasp. The stranger's face goes pale.
They... they have my family. They said if I led them to you, they'd be spared.
I'm sorry. I had no choice. Please...

Choice.Text: I understand desperation. But you can't stay.
Then help us fight them. Earn redemption.

Node.Text: I know. I'm sorry. I'll go...
Thank you for understanding. I... I hope you survive this.
Fight? Against them? *pause* ...You're right. I owe these people that much.
I know their tactics. I can help. Let me make amends.
Of course. I... I wouldn't dream of betraying the group.

DialogueTree.DisplayName: Captain Battle

Node.Text: So, you're the one protecting these traitors. It ends here.
Hand them over and I might let you walk away.
This isn't over! You can't protect them forever!
*The captain signals retreat*

DialogueTree.DisplayName: Border Crossing

Node.Text: Halt. State your business.

Choice.Text: These people are refugees seeking asylum.

Node.Text: *The guard examines the group*
*The guard looks at the tired but complete group*
You brought them all this far? Impressive. Enter, refugees. You're safe now.
Refugees? *looks at the weary group* Very well. You may enter.
Report to the refugee office in the town center.
Travelers with twenty people, half of them children? Don't insult my intelligence.
Refugees are permitted. Just tell the truth next time.

DialogueTree.DisplayName: Journey's End

Node.Text: We... we made it. We're actually safe.
I don't know how to thank you. You gave us our lives back.
We'll rebuild. It won't be easy, but we have each other.
And we have hope again, thanks to you.
*The elder looks at the group*
Every single one of us survived because of you. That's a miracle.
Please, take this. It's all we have, but you deserve so much more.
We lost some along the way... but those who remain will never forget.
Here. It isn't much, but please take it.

DialogueTree.DisplayName: Guild Offer

Node.Text: *The guild recruiter notices you*
You there. You look capable. I represent certain... business interests.
We're expanding our operations and need reliable people.
How goes the work? The guild master is eager for results.
I'm making progress.
We control trade in this district. But there's competition - another guild.
They're undercutting our businesses, stealing our contracts. It can't continue.

Choice.Text: What do you need from me?

Node.Text: Protection. Connections. And a generous cut of our profits.
10% of everything you bring in, plus bonuses for special jobs.

Choice.Text: Tell me more about the work.

Node.Text: It's business. We prefer... subtle methods. But yes, sometimes force is required.
That's where you come in.
First, we need intelligence. Then sabotage their operations.
Finally, we break their leadership. Simple, effective.

Choice.Text: I need to think about it.

Node.Text: Wise choice. Here's your guild charter - proof of membership.
The spy in the market can sell you information about our rivals. Start there.
Don't take too long. Opportunities like this don't wait.
Your loss. But don't interfere with our business - that would be... unwise.

DialogueTree.DisplayName: Buying Intel

Node.Text: *A shadowy figure waits in the alley*
*speaks quietly* You're from the guild. I have what you need.
But information has a price. 50 credits for their patrol routes.
I sell to those who can pay. What do you want?
And your credentials? I don't sell to just anyone.
*hands over a folded paper* Their warehouse on the docks. That's where they're vulnerable.
Strike at midnight when the guard changes.
*The spy considers your offer*
*sighs* 35. But only because I like the look of you.
Take it or leave it. 50 credits. My information is worth every coin.
*hands over the information* The warehouse. Midnight. Good luck.
Your choice. But don't blame me when you walk into a trap.

DialogueTree.DisplayName: Sabotage Operation

Node.Text: *You approach the rival's warehouse under cover of darkness*
*You spot two guards at the front, one at the back, and a loading dock*
The loading dock has a broken lock - easy entry.

Choice.Text: Create a distraction and take the front.

Node.Text: *You slip through the broken lock and into the warehouse*
Crates everywhere. In the corner, you see their ledgers and supply cache.
*You start a small fire in a trash heap across the street*
*Guards rush to investigate, leaving the entrance unguarded*
*The guards change shifts. There's a brief window of confusion*
*You're inside. The warehouse is full of trade goods*
*You puncture oil barrels, cut ropes, and contaminate their goods*
*This will cost them dearly*
*You find their shipping schedules and client lists*
*This intelligence is invaluable*
*You work quickly, sabotaging supplies AND grabbing documents*
*But you hear footsteps approaching*
*You slip out the way you came, undetected*
*A rival enforcer blocks your path*
Thief! You'll pay for this!
*You crash through a window and sprint into the night*
*Behind you, angry shouts echo*

DialogueTree.DisplayName: Guild War Climax

Node.Text: So, you're the one who's been destroying my operations.
I should have known your guild would resort to thuggery.
You fight well. But this changes nothing! My guild will rise again!
Wait! Enough blood has been spilled.
Perhaps... perhaps we can negotiate?
Then so be it. One of us ends here!
We divide the territory. No more fighting. Both guilds survive.
What do you say?

Choice.Text: My guild wants dominance, not sharing.

Node.Text: Then we have an accord. May it last.

DialogueTree.DisplayName: Guild War Finale

Node.Text: *The rival guild leader stands before you, sword drawn*
You've caused enough damage. This ends now.
Then draw your weapon. One of us leaves here victorious.
Talk? After you've destroyed my warehouses? Stolen my clients?
*pauses* But I'm not fool enough to ignore opportunity. Speak.

Choice.Text: Our guilds could merge. We'd be unstoppable.

Node.Text: Merge? Under whose leadership?
*considers* It's... not the worst idea. But my guild master would never agree.
Unless you can convince yours?
Territory lines? *strokes chin* That... could work.
You take the eastern district, we keep the west. The market stays neutral.
Then we have nothing more to discuss.
Then we have an accord. *extends hand*
May this peace hold longer than the last.

DialogueTree.DisplayName: Report to Guild Master

Node.Text: *The guild master awaits your report*
I heard what happened. You've destroyed our rivals completely.
With their leader gone, their guild will crumble. Well done.

Choice.Text: It's what you paid me for.

Node.Text: A peace treaty? I wasn't expecting that approach.
*considers* But territory without bloodshed? Perhaps it's wiser.
And you exceeded expectations. Here's your payment - plus a bonus.
You've earned a place among our inner circle.
True. And peace lets us consolidate without looking over our shoulder.
You've done well. Very well.

DialogueTree.DisplayName: Meeting the Merchant

Node.Text: *The merchant approaches*
Ah, a capable-looking traveler! Perhaps the gods have answered my prayers.
I need to make a trading run, but the roads are too dangerous to travel alone.
Ready to continue? We should keep moving while the weather holds.
My friend! Our journey together was most profitable. Need anything from my stock?
I have goods to deliver to two destinations. Fine merchandise that will fetch good prices.
But bandits roam the roads, and I'm no fighter. I need protection.
A share of the profits, of course! Say, 30% of what we make.
Plus, you can trade with my contacts at preferential rates.

Choice.Text: Make it 40% and we have a deal.

Node.Text: *The merchant considers your counteroffer*
Ha! You drive a hard bargain. Very well - 35%. You've earned my respect already.
I admire your boldness, but I can only go as high as 32%. Business must be sustainable.
First to a small town to deliver specialty goods. Then onward to a larger market.
It's a three-day journey if we keep a good pace.
Excellent! Let me gather my things and we can depart immediately.
Here, take some of the lighter goods - just in case we get separated.
I understand. The roads are indeed dangerous. Perhaps I'll wait for a caravan.
Onward to fortune! Stay alert - danger could come from anywhere.
Of course. I'll check the goods while you prepare. Don't take too long!

DialogueTree.DisplayName: Toll Checkpoint

Node.Text: Halt! This is an official toll road. 50 credits for merchant carts.

Choice.Text: [Intimidate] I'd recommend you let us pass.

Node.Text: Thank you for your cooperation. Safe travels.
*The guard considers your request*
Well... I suppose I could accept 30 for a small merchant like your friend.
The toll is the toll. Pay or turn back.
Pleasure doing business. Move along.
*You step forward menacingly*

Choice.Text: Back off, or you'll regret it.
Maybe this wasn't a good idea...

Node.Text: I... on second thought, merchants are exempt today. Move along.
Your choice. But the detour adds a full day to your journey.
*You find an alternate path around the checkpoint*

DialogueTree.DisplayName: Road Ambush

Node.Text: Well well, what do we have here? A merchant with goods and a guard?
Hand over the merchandise and nobody gets hurt.

Choice.Text: You'll have to take it from me.
[Pay 40] Take this and let us pass.

Node.Text: The hard way it is!
*You try to look unassuming*
Hmm... you don't look like you're worth the trouble. Move along.
Nice try. But I can smell a loaded cart from a mile away. Get them!
Smart move. This is enough for today. Get out of here before I change my mind.

DialogueTree.DisplayName: First Delivery

Node.Text: Ah, fresh goods from the capital! Let me see what you've brought.
Excellent quality. I'll take the lot.
*The shopkeeper examines your goods*
For goods this fine? 150 credits. And that's my best offer.
I can offer 120 credits. Take it or leave it.
160. That's as high as I go. Final offer.
Pleasure doing business. You're quite the negotiator!
A fair deal for both of us. Come back anytime.
Good. The goods are mine now. Safe travels.

DialogueTree.DisplayName: Roadside Inn

Node.Text: Welcome, travelers! Rest your feet and warm your bellies!

Choice.Text: What's the word on the roads ahead?

Node.Text: The northern pass is clear, but bandits have been spotted on the southern route.
If you're headed that way, stick to the main road. Strength in visibility.
Safe travels! May your purse grow heavy.

DialogueTree.DisplayName: Final Delivery

Node.Text: The traveling merchant and escort, I presume? We've been expecting you.
Your reputation precedes you. Let's discuss terms.
250 credits for the remaining stock. Standard guild rates.

Choice.Text: Standard? We took considerable risk getting here.

Node.Text: *The guild factor considers your point*
Hmm. I've heard about your journey. The hazards you overcame are impressive.
300 credits. And the guild will remember your name.
Risk is part of the business. 270, final offer.
Efficient. I like that. Here's your payment.

Choice.Text: The merchant has something for me as well.

Node.Text: A fair compromise. Payment transferred.
Well earned. The guild values competence.

Choice.Text: A pleasure. Now, the merchant owes me my share.

Node.Text: Ah yes! You've more than earned it. Here's your share - and a little extra for keeping us safe.
If you ever need work, look me up. It's been an honor traveling with you.

DialogueTree.DisplayName: Guardian of Yunohira Tenbōsho Dialogue
DialogueTree.Description: Dialogue tree for Guardian of Yunohira Tenbōsho

Node.Text: [AI: Boss accepts challenge with intimidating response]
So, you wish to challenge me? Very well! I, Guardian of Yunohira Tenbōsho, guardian of Yunohira Tenbōsho, accept!
You've drawn first blood... Impressive! But this battle has only just begun!
Enough holding back! WITNESS MY TRUE POWER! I will defend Yunohira Tenbōsho with everything I have!
You're stronger than I thought... I must be more careful now!
*breathing heavily* I'm nearly finished... Will you show mercy, or end this?
[AI: Guardian of Yunohira Tenbōsho expresses gratitude/confusion at being spared, yields and offers weapon/gold]
[AI: Guardian of Yunohira Tenbōsho accepts fate with honor, makes desperate final attack]
You have... bested me... Yunohira Tenbōsho... is yours... You've earned it...
[AI: Boss protecting Yunohira Tenbōsho. Theme: Challenge, guardian, test of strength]
[AI: Guardian of Yunohira Tenbōsho responds warmly, mentions nearby locations: YunohiraTenbōsho1, SakurajimaKōFerrybaSpoke1Ring5]
[AI: Guardian of Yunohira Tenbōsho provides lore about Yunohira Tenbōsho]
[AI: Farewell message]
